questions.text: What is the main purpose of the valuation?(E.g., M&A, financial reporting, internal decision-making, tax, other)
Please provide a brief description of the company you want to value (we will refer to it as "Target")
Which industry does the Target operate in?
Which best describes the Target's stage in the business lifecycle?
What is the Target's financial year-end?
Does the Target's capital structure include preference shares?
Over the past 12 months, has the Target been profitable?
As the Target is loss-making, please answer the following:

subQuestions.text: What is the primary reason for the losses?
Is the Target currently in distress?
Is the Target expected to turn around and become profitable in the coming years?

questions.text: Is the Target a single entity, or a Group of companies?
As the Target is a Group, please advise:

subQuestions.text: Are there any entities within the group that are (i) associates, (ii) joint ventures, or (iii) partially owned subsidiaries (i, ii, and iii collectively referred to as "Partial Entities")
As there are Partial Entities, please advise:
The number of Partial Entities that are significant (revenue or EBIT contribution > 10%)
The number of Partial Entities that are insignificant (revenue or EBIT contribution < 10%)

Are the past three years of (consolidated) historical financial statements available?(E.g., if the Valuation Date is 30 June 2024 and the financial year-end is 31 Dec, please provide FY21, FY22, and FY23 financials.)
Are (consolidated) management accounts up to the Valuation Date available?(E.g., if the Valuation Date is 30 June 2024, please provide management accounts up to 30 June 2024.)
Is a (consolidated) five-year financial forecast from the Valuation Date available?(If the Valuation Date is 30 June 2024, the forecast should cover 1 July 2024 to 30 June 2029.)
